Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: LukHel
Reviews.Content: The location is great, on the Rambla. The room was ok, a little worn. We got a room facing the Rambla, but there was no noise as long as the window was closed. Dull breakfast, so if it's not included, eat somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dread62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pleasantly fitted out, neat, tidy, clean and most of all very accessible. It has an excellent location right in the hub of the Ramblas area. Easy walking distance to Hop On Hop Off Buses, Tourist Information, The Port, Gothic Area etc. Excellent Place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jangadeiro
Reviews.Content: Nice location at Ramblas and near Placa de Catalunya. Also near to a lot of supermarkets and everything that you may need including restaurants, fun and tours. Appartment of back side are very quiet. Who want to see Ramblas and itis movement, front appartments may be better. Some things should be renewed since years ago like the carpet and the internet cable connection that is not reliable. It is also applicable for bathroom too, in special the shower. The space of appartment for 4 occupied by 2 in a queen bed (2X1) was very nice. Staff polite and friendly. Despite some problems like internet connection and other small one it was a nice choose and I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “For Independent Travelers, Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Domrcpl
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that after reading the mixed reviews about this hotel, I was very skeptical and I almost had the travel agent change our booking to another place. But it turned out okay for us. Just keep in mind that this is not a hotel in the common way tourists might think of one. It is partly an apartment, partly a hotel. Many of the services you might be used to in a regular hotel are not available here or they may cost extra, like everyday maid service. The rooms are smallish and yes, a bit tired. But if you don't care for bells and whistles and can fend for yourself, this is not a bad hotel to stay at. The room we got was quiet. There is a kitchenette with cooking utensils, plates, etc. There were a couple of times when we were just so tired from touring Barcelona (Barcelona is exhausting) that we were happy to be able to put together a quick, relaxed meal in the room. The Carrefour supermarket is literally across the street and the not to be missed La Boqueria open market is not much farther. You are right in the middle of La Rambla and in between 2 metro stops. If you just want to use the Aerobus to and from the airport, the bus stop is about a 10-minute walk. I felt safe in the hotel. Considering how much time we spent touring and exploring Barcelona, we did not mind staying at this place. But it is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie B
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona to welcome the New Year. This hotel/apartment is located on La Rambla near Metro Stops and La Corte Ingles. Just step outside to shopping, street vendors, the historic marketplace, cafes, and La Plaza Catalunya. The picture window on the second floor is great for people watching while having breakfast or utilizing the hotel's free internet. The rooms were comfortable but the location is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but the rooms are tired. Great location makes it worth staying here.”
Reviews.Author: chriskre
Reviews.Content: Booked this directly thru the timeshares/hotel website with a nonrefundable rate in Euros. If you find it cheaper on expedia or orbitz etc, you will probably get the same ugly rooms as booking direct so look for the cheapest room you can find. The hotel/timeshare is in the thick of all the reasons why you want to go to Barcelona as a tourist. Located directly on the Rambla street, you can walk to Plaza Catalunya, the gothic quarter and many other touristic areas of the city. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby. A grocery store is right across the street. Easy to get a taxi right outside the door. The hotel itself has friendly staff albeit with that Catalan aire about them. The rooms do NOT look like the website pictures. We had 3 rooms and none of them looked even remotely like the nice remodeled rooms. I suggested to the front desk clerk that they should be honest with the pictures of the rooms because it's deceiving. The rooms are very small. We booked studio doubles. The beds are very low to the ground. The carpeting is green as are the bathrooms. There is a small kitchenette in the rooms with a micro, minifridge, burner, dishwasher, toaster, percolator etc. No washer and dryers in the rooms but there is a very expensive laundry in the basement. 5 Euros to wash and 4 Euros to dry one load of laundry. Soap is included as it's a front loader. There is a security guard there day and night chasing off the local kids coming into the lobby to steal candy and probably more. The resort has wi-fi only in the lobby area. Internet is wired and free in the rooms. The television is small but has cable with just 3 English language channels and it's only news channels. There is a small awkward safe in the closet. You can't fit a netbook in it just a wallet and your passport. The elevators are tiny. If you have luggage you can only fit one person, two max in these elevators. There is a breakfast area but we did not try it. There is too many nice restaurants around the resort to eat in the hotel. There is no concierge here but they are helpful in steering you to the area where you can book tours. You will not get many toiletries in this hotel. Our soap dispenser was broken and they only gave us a tiny little round hand soap and a little bottle of shampoo and bath gel for two people. Luckily there is a market across the street to stock up. We paid for daily maid service. You have to pay extra to get it since this is really an aparthotel or timeshare. The cost is 6 Euros. They wash the dishes for you in the tiny dishwasher. All in all it was a convenient stay. I wouldn't want to stay any longer than we did which was 5 days. If you are staying longer find a place with a little more luxury or bigger rooms. The rooms can be claustrophobic after a week. The hotel is rated 3 stars. I guess that's accurate by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: RapiroSan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is on a exceptional location. If you want tourist attractions and some of the main night clubs, it is the spot to be. My low rating is due to the fact that it is an expensive hotel for what it delivers. Rooms are outdated, old bathroom fixtures, carpet and TV, the kitchnette doesn't encourage any cooking. HAd issues with the wi-fi connection which did not work during my stay. Air-condition was loud and had problems cooling off. Staff is friendly but limited. by the lobby decoration you'd think it would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: klimaflyktning
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location and the fact that there is a kitchenette. With dietary needs, it is important that we can prepare most of our meals. With the fabulous La Boqueria market and a Carrefour supermarket across the street, we were spoilt for choice when it came to fresh ingredients. The location is also convenient for the Aerobus and for getting lost in the narrow streets of the old town. We got a room to the back and it was quiet but a bit on the warm side. Opening the windows would let the noise in. Room and bathroom were quite large, clean, but a little tired. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for independent travel”
Reviews.Author: Sinatrapug
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Laundry facilities available and kitchenette in rooms. Very close to many things including the tourist information office. We ate breakfast at the local fruit market everyday a stones throw away from the hotel - excellent value. Bedrooms large but a little too hot. Overall a good place to stay and use as your base.

Reviews.Title: “Like comming Home”
Reviews.Author: ziggyperth
Reviews.Content: This is the third visit to this delightful hotel. Since the last in 2010 there have been some upgrades. The rooms are much cleaner and the bedding at last is updated. No more old blankets but clean linen. This location really cannot be beaten. Perfect for anyone going on a cruise or just for a visit. The kitchenette makes life so much easier than having to eat out and pay for overpriced food on the Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Average - not bad, just not as good as it should be.”
Reviews.Author: Collettell
Reviews.Content: Not the friendliest of places we stayed in during a 3 week visit to Spain. Wifi only available in a small area of the hotel, and modem resetting required regularly. Breakfast was ok. Close to everything on the rambles, but minimal tourist information offered, and available from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: willing292
Reviews.Content: this is our 2nd stay here in ten years. it is clean and a great location. security is very evident, which is good. the furniture is dated and the room itself is quite stark. if this hotel was in Canada, I probably would not stay in it, since it has no appeal. however, since it is in Barcelona, and Barcelona is an expensive city, I probably will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel5654
Reviews.Content: Hotel Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Room (with furnished kitchen) was spotlessly clean and well maintained. Location was a short walk to the Metro or city buses. Was the only hotel on our trip that had free internet access and a computer for guests to use. Enjoyed our six nights there and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: oldbluebagfaithful
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. Based upon feedback via trip advisor we booked a room at the back of the hotel to avoid the noise at the front of the hotel on Las Ramblas. On the first night we had a power failure in our room & although inconvenient we were moved immediately to one of the few vacant rooms which fronted onto Las Ramblas with the assurance that if this was unsuitable we could be moved the next day. Ely on the front desk was most helpful in sorting that out. We stayed in this room on the 4th floor as we found the noise levels acceptable & we were there during the Spanish national day celebrations with street parades up & down Las Ramblas day & night. We were able to watch the processions from our very small balcony & enjoyed the location. The good things about this hotel were the location, a comfortable bed & good shower. however the rooms need a complete upgrade with stained carpets & seats & a very old bathroom. The kitchenette was adequate. No Wi-Fi in rooms was a bit inconvenient - you had to go to the dining area for Wi-fi connection which wasn't always working.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Silvia A
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from USA and stayed in this hotel for 1 week in September 2011. We were pleased with the room, large enough and very clean. The location is absolutely perfect to reach every turistic site; easy access to shopping and good restaurants, the medieval town as well as the famous market La Boqueria, next to a supermarket etc. But mostly we were happy with their staff, from the cleaning lady to the receptionists. We loved Eli, she was warm and helpful and spoke perfect English. She recommended a great restaurant nearby, La Rioja, where we befriended the owner's husband and spent several evenings with good food and splendid Sangria. Overall a very good experience; we understand Citadines have locations in London and other big cities so we intend to use them whenever we can.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: manigirl
Reviews.Content: We usually use trip advisor to research hotels to stay in. We were a little short on time and got a travel agent to do the legwork this time. They recommended an apt in the Citadines and off we went. I had heard so many horror stories about pickpockets on las ramblas that I had myself worked right into a state despite the fact that I am quite well travelled. The cab driver from the airport even voluntarily warned us about pickpockets on this street. As we approached the hotel for the first time in the cab with so many people on the street, I admit I was intimidated and wondered if perhaps we had made a mistake in booking this hotel. My fears were misplaced. The Citadines Las Ramblas has a large welcoming entrance ideally located close to placa Catalunya. The desk clerks were friendly, patient and helpful. The rooms were nothing fancy but large by european standards and had everything we needed. Small dishwasher, kettle, stovetop, toaster, TV, bidet and great water pressure. There is wifi on the 1st floor with a small comfy seating area to sit and enjoy it. The hotel was so perfectly located that it was very easy to walk to the waterfront, to tons of shopping, to way too many great restaurants, and a very short distance to the main square where you can catch the bus touristic or anything else your travelling heart desires. The Mercat de la Boqueria is just across the street and a few steps down. There is also a grocery store right across the street and Gelato right outside the door. Check out was so easy we kept questioning them if that was all. Las Ramblas is like one big carnival. The street is filled with human statues at night. One of our favorite things to do was to leave everything in our rooms but bring a pocket full of change with us which we would drop into the buckets of the different human statues and watch them animate. We had no problems with pickpockets whatsoever. Just don't be rubbernecking with a giant back pack and camera slung across you. Get where you're going and you'll be just fine. If I went to Barcelona again, this is where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: raymondduclos
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located. You'll be close to everything you want to see, or you'll easily get there from this location. Plaza de Cataluna is around the corner, how great is that? You are directly on Ramblas, can't beat that! As for the hotel itself, it's basic. You have what you need, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and even a dishwasher, but don't expect anything fancy. In fact, you even have a Carrefour Grocery across the street, that is convenience. They will clean your room once a week only (you need to know that!) as agreed in the basic price of the room. But you can get more if you want, but that'll be extra $$. Hotel itself was quiet, although we had to call downstairs once to quiet a group of students coming back from a party at 2am. But staff acted quickly and it never happened again.

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned - Thieves working in hotel lobby”
Reviews.Author: Leslie G
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the hotel on August 20/11 at 10am, the lobby was very busy with guests checking out and in. We proceeded to line up to check in with our luggage. We had been very vigilant with our possessions while travelling through Europe prior to arriving in Barcelona. We no sooner had put our luggage down beside our feet, when we realized that our backpack was taken. It happened very quickly. No one else in the lobby witnessed it. The hotel security guard had just left his post at the front door and gone to the luggage storage room on the mezzanine level when the theft occurred. The hotel staff were very uncooperative after the incident happened. Infact, I had to ask them to call the police on 4 occassions. Finally, on the 4th request the front desk clerk called the police but we were told the line was busy. She pulled out a map of Barcelona and told us how to find the local police station by foot and to make a report. We were never offered a telephone to call to cancel our credit card which was in the backpack. Neither did the hotel staff ask what was taken and what was the value. We lost all our cash, iPad, camera with over 500 photos of our holiday, prescription glasses, tour tickets, chargers and cables, converter, holiday DVD's, and souviners and mementos. The hotel needs to have signage posted in the lobby to warn guests that theives are active in this area. The security guard needs to remain at his post in lobby and not be acting as a bell boy. There is a surveillance camera in the lobby, but we were told that only the police could view video tape. After filing our police report at the local station and waiting in a line up with many other theft victims, the police told us that they couldn't come to view the surveillance tape for 2 days. When we returned to the hotel we informed them that the police wouldn't be coming for 2 days. They said that the manager could possible view the surveillance video, but the manager wasn't working that day and no one else had the password to access the video tape. Later that day, when we were walking through the lobby, the front desk staff told us that they had viewed the video tape. What happened to the police and manager being the only ones being able to look at it?? They did say that there was a young man on the tape, looking very much like a typical tourist, who lifted our backpack. We never were allowed to view the tape at any time. I would recommend to anyone staying at this hotel to BEWARE of theives working in the lobby and perhaps other areas inside the hotel. The way the staff acted made us very suspicious ---- were they accomplices with the theft. We felt that we could not trust anyone there. Trusting Canadians

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Marylynn00
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is the greatest city in Spain, Cosmopolitan and pretty with great sights and a fun nightlife, a city that has something for every visitor. That sais , the Citadines Barcelona Ramblas is located in the heart of it all, right on the Ramblas one of the most famous streets in Barcelona, both famous for its life and for the pickpockets that pray on unsuspected tourists, we were warned against this and didn’t have an y trouble walking in the Ramblas although we took extra care of our belongings as one should always do when visiting any big city. It is near Plaza Catalunya metro stop which has several metro lines departing from there, line 1, line 3, and line 4, so you are able to move all the way across Barcelona. There is a small Carrefour Market just across the street and you can buy food and toiletries there. All the big stores are nearby, Zara, Tous, Armani, etc, if you want to go shopping there is also a Starbucks nearby although I recommend a more traditional local coffee shop with tables on the street as you can watch people just walking by, (keep an eye on your purse at all times). The hotel in itself has clean and comfortable beds and a small kitchen, but I do recommend eating out, Spanish food is great. The staff speaks English and eager to please and they are very helpful with directions. Apart from pickpockets which are not violent, it is safe to walk at night in Barcelona although beware on weekdays the metro stops at midnight and you will end up walking or taking a cab, night buses are available but go by every half hour. If you visit Barcelona this is a great value hotel as you won’t be spending much time in it and is very well located for you to drop by several times in the day for a quick change of clothes and or a nap. There is a department store nearby if you wish to feel at home, visit “El Corte Ingles”

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location.”
Reviews.Author: njschultz
Reviews.Content: Travelled with five friends and the rooms for three were definitely large enough. They were clean, comfortable and had generous sized bathrooms. Despite being right on Las Ramblas ( which is the very best thing about this hotel!!), the rooms were quiet. They had a nice lift. We didn't eat breakfast there ( not included in our room rate and quite expensive), but there is a Starbuck's across the street and, even better, a local small place serving traditional Catalan food called La Dolce about two short blocks away. There is one free computer in the lobby, and somewhat sketchy wi fi there, too. It didn't work with an iPad, but may have been fine for laptops. Overall, modern, but comfortable in decor. But the best thing is the unbelievable location in the middle of Las Ramblas! Taxi from the airport is about 25E plus bag fee, but the aerobus (5.3E) takes 40 min and drops you right in Plaça Catalunya, which is an easy 5-10 min walk with suitcases to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: KCHbomb423
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this for the European traveler. Complete with kitchen, mini balcony and spacious bedroom, I could not believe a hotel situated this close to Las Ramblas was such a great value and offered such privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jimfromalberta
Reviews.Content: The location simply could not be better. Right on the Ramblas and only a few minutes from Plaza Catalunya. We stayed two nights so the lack of maid service simply wasn't an issue. The room was large esp. for our purposes. Probably could be updated a bit. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent accomodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: EuroCorrespondant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citadines Ramblas for 3 nights in June. We had a double room at the back of the building which was great as it was quieter than the front. The room was decent if nothing fancy. Bed was large and comfortable - ask at reception for extra pillows if you want them. There was a decent desk to work at, a safe and a good amount of wardrobe space. The kitchen was well stocked with a fridge, toaster, grill microwave, crockery, dishwasher etc. Unfortunately our dishwasher did not work and despite us asking at reception for this to be fixed it never was. The bathroom is OK - shower pressure very good. The great thing about this place is the location - it is right on the Ramblas in the very heart of the city. It is really easy to get to from the airport - catch the A2 Aerobus for 5.3 Euros per person to Catalunya Square and it is only 5 minutes walk from there. All in all a decent place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great location - decent room”
Reviews.Author: Purnima8
Reviews.Content: the best part of this hotel is the location - right on the ramblas and a few minutes from catalunya square for the hop off hop on bus and all the shopping. decent room - adequate without being luxurious. small kitchenette - but as we just made breakfast it was enough for us. helpful staff - tomasso - thanks for referring us to a wonderful restaurant - 3 Gats! had a super time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: SeoknEddie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citadines Barcelona Ramblas from April 13-21 - 2011, we have been to many Citadines worldwide and we feel that this property is the oldest and most tired of all the Citadines that we have stayed in. Room looks nothing like the website. Very plain and old and looks like a budget hotel! Location is great as it is very near the La Boqueria (7 min walk) which is great for breakfast, Metro (Pl Catalunya) and shopping ( La Ramblas). Value is good if you are able to get the promotion rate. It is also within walking distance from the Airport bus stop in Pl Catalunya and where the tourism office and the tour buses run. The best thing about this place is location. There is also a Carrefour across the road for groceries. Internet is very slow albeit free and there is no wireless service. management need to look into this if they are targeting the business traveler. Room is very very basic, clean but very dated and the beds are very soft and the pillows have seen better days. Kitchenette is very well equipped if you want to cook a meal or 2. Please be aware that the rooms are only cleaned once a week and only if you stay more than 7 days. Otherwise you will have to pay to have room cleaned. Staff is cordial but service is not overly great. We didn't need much assistance so we were ok. We did see some issues other Guests had with their reservations. So we would advise that you follow-up with your reservations to avoid any confusion. We booked on the website and followed up with an email so we were ok and check-in was smooth. You should request for room at the back if not it will be noisy, additionally the walls are very thing so you can hear your neighbours and any activity in the corridors. We can't complain much as we got a very good rate, as such our expectations are lower. So if you get a good rate and the location is important to you but not so much the room and bed then we recommend you give this a go. All in all great location but a no frills property so don't expect too much from the room.

Reviews.Title: “not for business”
Reviews.Author: gizzzo
Reviews.Content: This may be good for big families on a budget on tourism travel but not for business people. The internet is slow, really slow. In some rooms, you have to open 2 doors just to get to your room and most of the time, the keys will only work in 1 door and you end up having to go downstairs and having it fixed... everyday. Never coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Apartment for Families!”
Reviews.Author: kathysjourneys
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here a one bedroom apartment for six nights in June. The apartment itself was a bit worn around the edges, but it had all of the basic comforts that we needed. The children slept in two beds that popped out of the living room sofa (it took a while to figure out how that worked, but then it was simple to do each day). We liked having a small kitchen area, and there is a large supermarket right across the street to buy coffee, breads, cheeses, fresh fruit, and other things. La Boqueria (the local market) is also just a couple of blocks down the street. We were on one of the upper floors that faced the front of the hotel, and we had a great view out over the city. We thought the location was ideal. We enjoyed walking down Las Ramblas each day, seeing the many talents of the street performers. One can escape the crowds by walking down any of the narrow streets that branch off into the Gothic Quarter. We loved the Gothic Quarter, especially the residential neighborhoods that are further away from Las Ramblas. Also, Plaza Catalunya was only a few minutes walk, where you can catch buses or trains that will take you almost anywhere you want to go. Train tickets can be purchased at the underground tourist office in the center area of Plaza Catalunya. While I wouldn't characterize the front desk staff as "super friendly", they did provide a city map and were willing to answer our questions when we needed information. We really enjoyed our time in Barcelona and felt that this hotel was great staging point for our many adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Passable, but not really as advertised”
Reviews.Author: e_moorefield
Reviews.Content: When we booked here, we were told that the Ramblas was the happening place in Barcelona that we needed to check out. Not so, unless wall-to-wall people, pick-pockets and con-artists are your idea of exciting night-life. We arrived at the hotel at sunset on Saturday night. When we got to our room, we found that instead of a queen bed, we had a sleeper sofa/ roll-out bed contraption. Also, if you register online, selecting non-smoking serves no purpose. We were informed that all rooms allow smoking, and the suites that have real queen beds cost twice what our room did. We were able to get moved the next morning to a room that didn't reek of tobacco, and we just lived with the sleeping arrangements. We quickly discovered that we wanted to stay off the Ramblas after about lunch time. The saving grace of this hotel's location is that right outside the door is an alleyway that leads out the back of the building into the medieval quarter. We exited in theat direction 80% of the time when we went out. There's a lovely little courtyard in back, with Roman ruins right there behind the hotel. Fantasic! The other great saving grace was the concierge, was the night desk clerk, who gave us one fantastic restaurant recommendation after another. He single-handedly salvaged what could have been a wretched stay for us. All things considered, I might send my kids to stay here on a college vacation, but I'll find someplace away from the Ramblas with a real bed and no smoke smell next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotspot location, modern hotel, great room except for the bed”
Reviews.Author: chi_city_trippin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on La Rambla, in the middle of all the action. The hotel staff was helpful and the room itself was decent. My only complaint about the room is that the advertised "two twin beds" that we paid for was actually a sleeper sofa with two mattresses on two frames stacked on top of each other. We had to pull the two beds apart to setup our sleeping arrangement. Other than the 1970s sofa, the room was alright. We stayed for 4 nights, which didn't qualify us for room service. We were told that if we wanted room service, it was available to us for a 6 euro fee. If I remember correctly, a minimum stay of 6 nights is required for room service to be included in the nightly rate. The hotel provides internet access in the rooms, but only through a LAN cable which you have to pickup at the frontdesk and provide a 5 euro security deposit for. The 5 euro is reimbursed upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sydney_CJ
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was not disappointed at all with the Citadines and would gladly stay there again. Stayed with two friends in a one bedroom apartment (Queen + sofabed) overlooking the rear square - so we had a nice view and it was much quieter than the front - which is right on Las Ramblas. Hotel is easy to get to, near AeroBus stop and major underground lines. Hotel staff were nice enough and happy to help whenever we needed them - perhaps because we speak a little Spanish? (it always helps). The room was great - enough space with well stocked kitchen so we could cook at home (major grocery store is across the road). Big bathroom with excellent shower and water pressure! All very clean. There is free internet in the lobby but be prepared to wait for the queue. There is also free wi-fi which worked fine. Only drawback was the bed was a bid tired and soft and the pillows far too soft for my liking. Overall, I would definietly stay here again when I'm back in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “extremely poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: geckogirl_10
Reviews.Content: Ripped us off trying to cram us into a 2 person studio. when it was VERY clear that he rubbed out our earlier booking of a 4 person apartment, we actually had to correct him that NO we were not 2 people. Just ended up wheeling in an extra bed to what was essentially a living room. Smarmy rude staff who knew they'd done us over! Barcelona great though :)

Reviews.Title: “Great or Horrible hotel depending on your neighbors”
Reviews.Author: uerbaogoid
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great hotel. It’s located in the Rambla, close to Pl. Cataluña. The staff is very helpful; the rooms are spacious and clean with every amenity and cable internet access in addition to the wifi in the lobby. All in all, it’s a perfect place to stay if you’re going to Barcelona for any reason. Nevertheless, the apart-hotel rooms have a one small feature that can make or break your stay. Our room had a communicating door with the next room (designed to accommodate larger groups I think) so the sound isolation is very bad. On our second night, a couple of male friends arrived and they almost ruined our vacation with loud music, shouting and whistling. The only thing that saved us was that they went out every night (at about eleven o’clock at night so the music was turned off and only returned at about seven o’clock in the morning. In conclusion, it’s a great hotel but the quality of your stay will certainly depend on your luck with the neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: PSavant
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location in the middle of all the action right on the Las Ramblas near the Catalunya Square. We took a cruise and the port was also not too far. We were a big group (5 rooms) and the hotel accommodated all of us on the same floor. The sight-seeing tours depart from the Catalunya Square nearby. All the shops and restaurants are spread all around the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Diego_Z
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed Citadines Barcelona. It's right on the ramblas (the main tourist street), close to everything. There's a Carrefour supermarket just across that is great to buy food and cook in your own kitchen. You can even walk and do your shopping at the famous Boqueria Market that is just 2 blocks away. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: SQTravellers
Reviews.Content: Clean, well-equipped rooms, friendlu professional staff, goofd lcoation. Hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the Action!”
Reviews.Author: lisam6028
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Citadines and thought it was brilliant. We were lucky to be on our second trip to Barcelona and we knew where we were heading, so we caught the areobus from the airport to Plaza Catalunya then wandered down the ramblas to the Citadines. On arrival the front desk were very pleasant and friendly and we were pleasantly suprised by the standard of our accom. We looked out over the small square at the back of the hotel which was very nice, busy enough to be interesting to watch but also not so busy that it was really noisy. I must admit, I was slightly worried about sleeping on a sofa bed for 3 nights but it was actually really quite comfy (although it was a little squeaky every time you turned over in the night - probably a good thing that neither of us are particularly light sleepers!) The room was well equiped with everything we needed including an iron & ironing board, safe, dishwasher (although sadly the instructions were not in English so we just bunged the tab in and put it on!) even a bottle opener which was great and is often forgotten abroad - loads of room for storage and the bathroom was a good size, although the shower needed de-scaling. As everyone else has said the location is the best thing, right in the heart of all the action so everything is easily reach-able from here. The supermarket across the road was very reasonably priced lovely chocolate crosiants for 1 euro and wine from 0.68cents- can't get better than that!!! We stayed in a hotel last time and paid more money for less so if I went again I'd definatley stay at the Citadines.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, best location, very helpful staff and a clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: deeptiprateek
Reviews.Content: its a very very well located hotel, right on the vibrant and never sleeping street of las ramblas, plaza de reial, which has a ton of pubs and bars, is just behind it and so is the vast area for shopping.. its a good and a safe neighbourhood. the room has a kitchen which is fully equipped with a refrigerator, dish washer, oven, microvave, utensils, a gas burner, mats, a kettle, cuttlery and a table too for eating.. it also helps that a supermarket is just right across, and you can cook on y our own . its excellent if you are staying there for a longer time also , i was there for 12 days.me and my husband were in europe for our honeymoon and we had teh best time in this city.. the hotel also provides a laundry room, which you are allowed to use at a euro per use. the bathroom is neat and clean and had a tub instead of a shower. the staff is very very helpful and sweet, even to non spanish speaking people like us. the location is so amazing that even at very very late hours of the night we could return back safely, even if we were completely high.. there was a cleaning service evryday too and a buffet breakfast which was served till ten was nice too.. its near the barcelonetta beach and the port olympic.. the best way to see the whole city is on a bike,, the traffic is not too much and riding along the beach is just amazing in the mornings...plaza catalunya is just two hundred meters away and so are the amazing shops and ever so popular cortes ingles.. all in all i would highly recommend the hotel and barcelona to everyone and anyone..

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, perfect room but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: nicolesandra
Reviews.Content: We loved our trip to Barcelona and Citadines Ramblas was very well located... Center of everything, close to MERCAT BOQUERIA, which was great and a subway/metro just a block aaway. I do recommend this hotel but please, be aware, the staff is rude and unhelpfull. Some of the staff do not speak English either. They cleaned our room on the 4th day and when we asked them to use the lobby phone (because the public phones in the entrence weren't working) they gave us a big s *sigh* before dialing a local hotel where friends were staying. Anyways, in general, Barcelona residents are OK but they have this grudge and we only could figure it was because we spoke a little Spanish and no Catalan, which they do not appreciate. They should really work on that because they have a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_Elchin
Reviews.Content: I got excellent deal for this hotel. I book through their website and got double room with two separate beds for only 84 euro per night. The room was on the 6th floor and very light. I took Airport Bus from/to airport and hotel's convenient location meant that I did not have to use taxi. We felt safe and our room did not face Rambla, so it was not noisy during the day/night. I am very pleased with this hotel and I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: NJtravelor10
Reviews.Content: Pros- Good location, large rooms with double bed, nice bathroom, equipped with refrigerator and microwave, helpful front desk Cons- Air Conditioner setting needed adjustment, worn carpet, bed was too soft

Reviews.Title: “good for families”
Reviews.Author: SandraJowitt
Reviews.Content: location is good : ) we were very disappointed with the stale smoke smell permeating through the carpet the apartment was very tired looking and not terribly clean but it was probably from everything just being extremely worn and old shower was good, hairdryer quite pathetic there is a sliding door that separates the double bed from the other living area where our 3 kids each had their own bed, which was good value for money good supermarket across the road meant we could nip over to buy breakfast supplies would recommend to a family who wants to stay together in the one apartment, but wouldn't recommend to ppl travelling w'out kids!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Rejsetips
Reviews.Content: Very nice and friendly appart hotel in the middle of everything. Perfect for the teens - safe hotel with friendly 24*7 reception and free internet access. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but attendant was rude and not helpful”
Reviews.Author: eveline_4u
Reviews.Content: Location - good. Worth $236.00 Cdn. per night - no. Staff - to be desired (not all staff - one young man was very helpful) (other attendant - older man - rude and obnoxious and gave one of our prepaid rooms away to another tourist). Check-in time: If your lucky, your room might be ready by 5 p.m. Would I stay here again - NO Definitely not. There is many more hotels at a far better rate in great locations with helpful, smiling staff. Great hotels, good prices closer to the marina, christopher columbus statue - awesome area, scenic and 5 minute walk to La Ramblas. Toronto, ON

Reviews.Title: “My birthday vacation”
Reviews.Author: lopraq
Reviews.Content: The friends and family I brought with me was very happy. The location could not be better ! Just araound the corner we had the old Barcelona. In front of La Rambla , you cant find it better Shopping for breakfest, as we did in our own kitchen, was easylly. done.: the supermarket is just opposite the hotel. (The hotel breakfast was too expencive regarding to what you get) Fresh fruit for that :you get at the Market a little stroll down La Rambla. So all in all you could not be in a better place in Barcelona !!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: edinburghh
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3nights in 2007. The hotel itself was right in La Ramblas - brilliant location with the main street just outside! street entertainment on your doorstep. Reception staff very friendly. Only thing was the room had a horrible sofa bed and that was the downer because the bedding looked old and tired. I'm sure it was clean but faded and we were not impressed with the sofa bed. Apart from that - no problems! Our room was at the back so we had no noise what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “La Citadines location location!”
Reviews.Author: ziggyperth
Reviews.Content: I was more than impressed with this hotel. From first arrival at 6am in the morning we were allowed to book into our room. The beds were large and very comfortable. The fact we could cook or use the microwave made our stay so much more comfortable. The scenery from our window of La Rambla below was entertaining. Convienience to the port and all amenities was a bonus. This hotel is great for anyone and for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: What
Reviews.Content: We like the Citadines format and this is the best we have stayed at. Fantastic location on Las Ramblas and almost across the street from the fabulous Boqueria market; very friendly and helpful staff (reception staff spoke perfect English); spotlessly clean; well maintained; and quiet. Given it's location we were worried about noise but we need not have been. We too had safe problems but two people came to fix it in minutes and turned out to be a very cheerful fellows as well. We enjoyed talking to them. The kitchenette was very well equiped - better than the minimalist approach at the Paris Citadines. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel. One of the resons we stay at Citadines is so we can make our own breakfasts, and other meals as well sometimes. It saves money and allows you to sample the local specialties. Whatever you do do NOT miss the market - absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Family stay with safe problems”
Reviews.Author: Gurion
Reviews.Content: I booked through a european web site and paid in advance. I went til Barcelona for two warm days with husband and two sons for a short stay before cruise in the Med. Barcelona is certainly one of our favorite cities, and after we tried the Citadines in Paris we would like to try it in Spain as well. I booked one large apartement with a bedroom, and we actually got two adjoined double bed bedrooms, each with a double bed, no sofa or living room here, but two bathrooms and ttwo small kitchenette. Comfortable beds here, not as hard as the ones at the Citadines we stayed at in Paris. But the problem here, no sitting area for the family gatherings. well, not much need for that either, we stayed in between beach and dinner hours. What really would have been useful, was a safe in order to work. Because of the two bedrooms we had two safes, and neither of them ever worked. My husband stayed in several times in order to wait for the maintenance guy, wait for him to finish etc. At the wall by the safe there is a note saying that there is a safe in the reception as well. Before beach the first day we took all our valuables and went down there, and there was a lot of misunderstandings and the lady attending the reception really did'nt understand much. We ended up putting most things in locked suitcases and bringing the rest to the beach. This time Citadines did well in giving us rooms on a quiet side of the building, far from city noise, on the 8th floor. No smoking rooms we got too, but not no-smoking curtains! There were several holes in them, burned from guests leaning out of the window smoking? The roof terasse was long time closed when we were there, some working going on. Too bad, check before booking if outdoor space with nice view is important to you. I booked with the Yeego website, in order to get a good price with breakfast included. The breakfast is very nice, coffee great and the breakfast room have a wonderful Rambla view. The eggs were raw, and when we found out we could put them in the automatic eggboiler ourselves, the mashine made so much noise we had to turn it off again because of complants from other guest. Som new curtains, new eggboiling routines, new safes and a little more helpful and attendig reception staff, this place will shine and be worth all the euros!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BoCyn
Reviews.Content: Took the express airport bus to Plaza de Catalunya and walked a couple of blocks, with luggage, to the Citadines. The hotel was right on La Ramblas and fortunately our room was toward the back so we did not get much noise. The hotel was very clean and the front desk was attended 24/7. There was a secure place for luggage storage. The room had a mini fridge, stove, microwave, coffee pot and enought kitchen items. The two twins beds, as opposed to pull out sofas, were semi comfortable and the room was big enought for two. There was an El Cortes Ingles store right at Plaza Catalunya where we did our grocery shopping for ther few days we were there. We paid 140 euros/night and booked directly on Citadines web site.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Citadines”
Reviews.Author: aquarianna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Citadines for our first trip to Barcelona because of its central location and the kitchenette to keep restaurant costs down. We were immediately pleased with the cleanliness of the lobby and friendly service from the front desk. Our room was a single, located on the 2nd floor. At first we were disappointed to not have a view of the street - our room was along the side of the hotel and looked out onto an adjacent building's rooftop and a few apartments. However, this turned out to be a bonus because it was the quietest side of the building. Our windows were similar to patio doors and you could step out onto the rooftop if you wanted. There was a maintenance man who came up to the roof occasionally to water the plants. Usually we had our window open when we were in our room with no concerns. The room was spotless and felt like a small apartment. The Citadines does not have daily room service; if you are there at least 7 days, which we were, they come by mid-week to clean and provide fresh sheets, towels and amenities. Otherwise you can either do laundry in the facilities provided or request fresh towels at an extra cost. It was nice that the hotel provided everything you need for at least one day (soap, shampoo, toilet paper, dishwasher detergent) until you can get to the "supermercado" - which is conveniently directly across the street. The Citadines chain provides a sofa bed, so you have a sitting room during the day and pull-out bed at night. The bed was so-so in terms of comfort, but I've certainly slept on worst. The room also had a mini stereo system and small TV, large mirrored-door closet, shelving unit, pull-out dining table and 2 chairs. The kitchenette was equipped with a small sink, microwave, mini-dishwasher, mini-fridge plus all dishes, pots and utensils you could possibly want. The bathroom was much larger than expected (for Europe) - a full-size bathtub with handheld shower and sink with large granite counter and storage cupboard. We were also impressed with the service - we could not get the climate control to work, and a maintenance person appeared within 5 minutes of us contacting the front desk. You can't beat the location - we walked everywhere from this hotel and the metro is about 2 minutes up the street at Placa Catalunya, where there is also a tourist information office. Although the Rambla is known to have its "seedy" elements, we never felt unsafe and security people "guardia urbana" are usually within sight. We walked the Rambla many times day and night with no incidents. All in all I would say that this hotel met North American standards and certainly was one of the best "3-star" places we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: LoLoChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citadines apartment hotel in Barcelona in February 2008. I booked this hotel at the last minute as the apartment I rented with VBRO had a fire and was not available. Booking was easy and we rented an apartment for 1-4 persons, at 225.00 euros per day for a 5 night stay. This is more than an regular apartment would cost, but I was booking at the last minute and wanted the ease of a hotel with apartment convenience. The apartment is laid out nicely, with step-out large balcony with large sliding glass door. The bedroom is good size and has a sliding door to the living room/kitchen/dinning area. So when the bedroom area is open it gives you a spacious feeling. The bathroom is spacious but shows stains around the faucets. In fact the room is very worn, cigarette burns on the rug, tired out looking furniture, we could not connect our IPOD to the older TV, so we could not view US movies that we brought. The hotel has free internet in the business center. This hotel is located right on the Ramblas 122, and in the middle of everything. Since it was February I figured that it wouldn’t be too frantic and noisy on the Ramblas at that time of the year. The Ramblas was busy, but you are in the middle of everything, across from a grocery store and down a few steps from the famous market Sant Joseph market. The Bari Gotic is diretly behind the hotel so we could walk to all the sites, and we were able to walk to the Placa Reial and the restaurant La Fonda late and we did not have to wait in the long line to get a table. Taxis stopped right in front of the hotel, and the Placa de Catalunya is a 10 minute walk, where you can find the Bus Turistic, buses to the airport and the metro. The major problem was the noise from the small square park-like area behind the hotel; this is also a street that is one of the entrances to the Gothic area. There were 2 café’s that stayed open late and the noise drifted up as well as the cigarette smoke to our room. But the absolute worse was the hippie type homeless people and their barking dogs that hung out in the park all night long. There were a few mentally ill homeless people who would scream randomly at night. Because the buildings were tall the noise traveled up to our 6th floor apartment. The air-conditioning was not on yet, but the room was stuffy so we were opening and closing the window all night long. We almost checked out early, but the convenience of the location and the fact that I had already booked this as my 2nd choice we just stayed. We live in a urban city area so our tolerance for city noise is very high. Plus side: We could walk out see some sites, come back rest, have a bathroom break and go back out again, that is a plus when you are doing all the tourist things. Having the kitchen was very nice for us, as we shopped at the market and could eat snacks and a meal in our apartment. But for the price I can not recommend this apartment-hotel. If you are looking for a hotel you can definitely do better. If you are looking for an apartment you can find better on line and cheaper on line.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - This is not hyberbole”
Reviews.Author: Barry Lynch
Reviews.Content: Just about the perfect location.. The apartments are spotless, well appointed, spacious and I can't find anything negative to say about the place. The staff are are friendly, helpful and informative. My only reservation is that the breakfast at €13.00 may be excellent, but why bother when you can cross the Ramblas to the Cafe Guinart, at the market entrance, and have a Cafe Con Leche and Serrana Ham Baguette for €4.00 per person. Also, it's good to see that they have a sense of history and have a picture of George Orwell in the Lobby, opposite his sniper position on the roof of theTeatre Poliorama during the Spanish Civil War. Excellent, try here before anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BethanCardiff
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here during the last weekend in January, we had a great time and found these apartments to be in a great location with easy access to most of Barcelona, as two girls travelling we were pleased with the 24 hour reception, which was manned by friendly, helpful staff (except one, who seemed to take a dislike to my friend!). The rooms were great, they were clean and tidy with plenty of space. We found the rooms very warm and couldn't work the air conditioning, but this wasn't a problem as we could open the window without worry as we were so high up.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Citadines”
Reviews.Author: E.Clements
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break to Barcelona. Having been there many times we always wanted to try an apartment. Booking the Citadines was a pleasant surprise. Right in the middle of Las Ramblas (which we knew). Our studio apartment turned out to be a large bedroom, very modern and a dinky little kitchen with all mod cons. Even the bathroom didn't let us down. Plenty of space everywhere. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but what's an American in Europe to do these days?”
Reviews.Author: gmurphyjc
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights here and had a perfectly enjoyable stay. The location is perfect; many attractions were in easy walking distance and the totally efficient metro stops just a short distance away. The room was clean and pleasant and the amenities were as promised--nothing more, nothing less. The staff was polite and for the most part helpful. The only downside is that the price that can buy you a true luxury hotel room in many cities buys just a standard, decent room in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: JanneSiru
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of busy La Rambla and your budget is not more than 140 euros per night you may choose Citadines. If you prefer to make your own meals or at least breakfast you may choose Citadines. If you want to have superb service and/or luxury you should go somewhere else. Citadines location in Barcelona is excellent. Just few minutes from Plaza Catalunya and superb public transpotation connections. Just across the La Rambla is Carrefour Express - large groceries store for those who prefer to use kitchenette as we did. Starbucks is also less than one block away. Citadines has two main buildings. Villa Madrid is located on the back and we had french balcony to guiet backyard of La Rambla. Excellent location since you get good night sleep even you're located just few minutes from La Rambla. Citadines also offers chance to book longer periods and for a week or two it could be a valid pick but for longer stays we would choose cheaper accommodation somewhere in greater Barcelona area since public transport is better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MAMLOOHAH
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in july...2007 It's terrible!the sheets are very old ...the shower is very old also...even the dryer!!!! and the BIG PROBLEM IS THE A/C! It's very hot we could'nt sleep... we told the front desk about it ...they told us all the a/c's in the hotel are the same ....! they dont have room service...NO body changed our sheets !or cleand the bathroom! i hated this place... DONT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: Travelsinger
Reviews.Content: Because I have stayed in the Citadines properties in Paris, I decided to try the Citadines on the Ramblas. It was fabulous, and I enjoyed my stay there as much as I have in the Paris properties. The location couldn't be better and the studio was roomy and clean with a well-appointed sitting room, kitchen, and plenty of shelf-space in the bathroom. They even have a shower curtain in the shower, which is rare in Europe. Add a small balcony, and what more could you want? It's a nice walk to the waterfront and a short walk in the opposite direction to Placa Catalunya and the El Corte Ingles department store, complete with a wonderful "Supermercado" (supermarket) in its basement. A truly great experience on all levels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gap12
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a mate having arrived after 15hrs on planes from New York, Madrid and Barcelona. The staff were friendly and welcoming right from the start, with plenty of charm and good humour (which we found unusual in Spain on the whole)! Rooms were very clean and well maintained. It's in a great location for the night-life (ramblas) and was within easy walking distance of good bars, resturants, and other attractions. I'lld recomend this mainly for younger people, singles or couples as the nightlife in the immediate area is vibrant to say the least. Overall, a great hotel with excellant service, presentation and modern amenities, would stay there again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3* in a 5* location”
Reviews.Author: AscotSteve_C
Reviews.Content: We are just back after spending 5 nights at the Citadines over New Years. Finding suitable European accommodations for a family of 4 (18months and 6 year old children) is never easy but the Citadines have been a saviour. We’ve stayed at several and would rank the Barcelona location as a solid 3*. Great location with fabulous market and Starbucks 2min away. Room for the family to unwind and nice to be able to tuck the kids in and have a bottle of wine to wrap up the day. We walked to the zoo, aquarium and beach. Metro connections were also convenient. We found the staff very helpful and although the room was not cleaned daily we expected that. If we wanted the 5 Star treatment we could of squeezed into the Meridian across the road for twice the price (if they took the 4 of us in one room). When we arrived home we realized that we had left our 18month old’s stuffed teddy bear in the room. You can imagine how traumatic this was. I emailed the hotel immediately and they replied the next day to say that housekeeping had found it next to the trash bin and assumed that it was rubbish so it was thrown out. Mistakes happen but the manager asked us to send a photo and other details. She promptly replied that although the Gund cat was not available in Europe they had ordered one from the US and shipped it directly to us. In my mind this was above and beyond the call of duty and a good indication of their attention to customer satisfaction. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ragan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in terms of location!!! Our stay in Barcelona was really fantastic and had to be tainted by the fact that unfortunately no one in the hotel staff took us seriously when we told them we had been robbed from the room on our last day. We had to deal with them via email and phone and we basically were sent on a wild goose chase. We have been back home since Nov 11 and this incident occurred in late October and we only received reference from them a week ago to say that there was no evidence for "forced entry". Hmmm.... when you leave without something that you arrived with and it has been kept locked up the whole time you were in Barcelona in the room (and your padlock goes missing)... where else could it go??? Maybe our souvenirs had LEGS!!!!! Who knows?? DONT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: nana-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real treat. We had just come off a Princess Mediterranean cruise and were ready for a little down time so really appreciated the good kitchen facilities and the spaciousness of this appartment hotel. The accommodations are not deluxe, but everything was immaculate and very comfortable. A fabulous food market is about 1 1/2 blocks away and a supermarket is across the street. We ate out most of the time but really enjoyed being able to make our own breakfasts and late night snacks. Great location - easy access to many areas of the city and it was fun to watch the action on the Ramblas from our large windows - the soundproofing worked very well, so we could see but didn't have to listen. Hotel staff were helpful and courteous. From Regina, Canada

HotelInfo.Name: Citadines Barcelona Ramblas
